content.raw:
With low bandwidth and long latency delays, I think you'll need to carefully filter and relay messages over to the OCU from FC. You maybe able to get by with a max downlink of 2Mbit/s. However, with the combined effect of the 20s latency, you may start to notice issues (especially if using TCP). I think part of the challenge is to figure out the best protocol and method for communication.

For example, try simulate 10s outbound latency on your simulator machine:

~~~
# replace eth0 with your network interface
sudo tc qdisc add dev eth0 root netem delay 10000ms
~~~

and on another computer, `ping` should correctly give you a 10000ms latency. Now try echo some simulator ROS topics. The behavior may not be what you have expected.

when done, remove the `tc` rule:

~~~
# replace eth0 with your network interface
sudo tc qdisc del dev eth0 root
~~~

We could expose the simulator ROS topics to OCU but when the network restrictions kick in, I'm not sure how reliable they will be.
